intro: Phyteuma fistulosum, commonly known as the common phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and purple, bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Phyteuma fistulosum is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
